title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.28 | 07-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Gyanatimiran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chaksharan Militam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamennithi Namine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Sri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 28th verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Jigna Sitaatam
Yatharthyo Muner Vyasa Sutadasau
Hithvedam Rupa Gangayam
Yasyati Adha Akutobhayam
The meaning of this verse is
After inquiring about proper self-knowledge from the son of Vyasa Deva
who will be a great philosopher
he will renounce all material attachments
and achieve a life of fearlessness
Akutobhayam
So Srila Prabhupada explains
this is the foretelling about what will happen
when he is cursed to die within seven days
he will renounce all material attachments
and he will go to the sacred place of earth.
He will go to the sacred place of earth.
He will go to the sacred place of earth.
place on the bank of the river Ganga and he will inquire about proper self-knowledge from
the son of Vyasa Deva from Shukadeva Goswami Vyasa Sutta and he will achieve a life of
fearlessness. So what is that life of fearlessness? Prabhupada explains. The purport. Material knowledge
means ignorance of the knowledge of one's own self. The self is spirit, spirit soul, spiritual nature,
same nature as the Supreme Lord. Not this material body or material nature not material not matter
but spiritual reality won't be there. An interior body is just Watson course of this reading so
you will also become an interior body full of spiritual types not material released which plays
aší dot accumulations of the leadership powers to create a spiritual nature. The message now in the
opposite of matter so Srila Prabhupada says philosophy means to seek after the
right knowledge of one's own self or the knowledge of self-realization we are
born into ignorance so in ignorance we do not know who we are we think I am
this body or we may think I am this mind but we are neither the body nor the mind
we are not even at the intelligence but we are spirit soul so this correct
understanding of our real self as spirit soul is called self-realization so Srila
Prabhupada says about self-realization
without self-realization philosophy is dry speculation or a waste of time and
energy there are many philosophers in this world and they have the ability to
think about what is the absolute truth what is this world who am I or what is
the ultimate reality they can think about it
but
if they don't take proper guidance from a self-realized
soul from a enlightened person then they simply speculate and
waste time and energy so Srimad Bhagavatam gives the right knowledge of
one's own self
Bhagavatam gives the right gift.
to Dinge Viz way of thinking about it.
is that special literature which gives knowledge of one's own self and by
hearing bhagavatam one can get free from material attachment and enter into the
kingdom of fearlessness so distinctly bhagavatam tells us there is a world we
are living in which is the world of fear and there is a spiritual world which is
the world where there is fearlessness there is no fear akutobhayam
so we are meant to prepare ourselves by becoming free from all material
attachment
and thereby keeping the goal of life as entering into the kingdom of
fearlessness the kingdom of God so Srila Prabhupada says this material world is
fearfulness spiritual world is fearlessness material world is fearfulness
its prisoners are always fearful as within a prison house
this material world has been discovered as a prison house
in the- just like in a prison house no one can violate the jail rules and regulations
and if they do violate that means another term for extension of prison life
similarly in this material existence we are always fearful
somebody may say I'm not afraid of death I'm not afraid of anything I'm a bold person courageous
person somebody may say that but as soon as there is some danger to his life immediately he starts
becoming fearful till there is no danger or there's no apparent difficulty or problem people
may speak so many things but they stop speaking all this rubbish when there is actual danger for
their life actually the fearfulness in this material world is called anxiety everyone in
material life in all species and varieties of life is full of anxiety full of anxiety
you
either by breaking or without breaking the laws of nature some people they break the
laws of nature because they are sinful and some people are avoiding sin so they adhere to the
laws as far as possible but both the categories of people have got one common desire for sense
gratification material enjoyment so such people anyway are always in anxiety
so therefore Srila Prabhupada says liberation or mukti means getting relief from these constant anxieties
these anxiety is described in the Bhagavatam Sada Samudvigna Dhyam A-sat-grahat life in the material world means Sada always Samudvigna Dhyam always being in peace
all your entire race, all the various events are connected to you
and your starting point are connected to God

Life in the material world means
Sada always
Samudvigna Dieam
meritorious relations is there between you and your opponent any based on your limits of knowledge and passion
always bewildered in one's own mind,
always filled with anxiety
because Asad Grahat have accepted something false as real.
It's like we accept this body as the self,
but this body is not the self.
This body is simply an external covering of the real self.
So therefore, as long as we are not enlightened
about our real self, we will always be in anxiety
with false understanding of our actual self
as this material body.
And this material body is always subject to disease,
old age, death, misery, suffering.
So always in anxiety, always in anxiety.
So how is it possible to get relief from all anxieties?
That is possible only when the anxiety is changed
to devotional service of the Supreme Lord.
We should not simply try to counteract anxiety
by some material methods.
Which we generally do.
No, that's not going to be successful.
We should turn to devotional service of Krishna.
Only way to become completely free from all anxieties.
So Srila Prabhupada says,
Srimad Bhagavatam gives us the chance to change the quality
of anxiety from matter to spirit.
To become the true self.
So this is possible only when we are not enlightened
about our real self.
How is this done?
This is done in the association of a learned philosopher
like the self realized Shukadeva Goswami,
the great son of Sri Vyasadeva.
Shukadeva Goswami instructed Parikshit Maharaj,
what should Parikshit actually do
to prepare for death and achieve perfection,
going back to Godhead.
After quitting the body.
Other saintly persons could not give this assurance,
to the entire world.
What is the difference to Parikshit?
That means all other methods,
other than the methods suggested by Shukadeva Goswami,
are not effective in helping us to prepare for death
in such a way that at the end of this life,
we can go back to Godhead.
So Shukadeva Goswami recommended
to Parikshit Maharaj that you become Krishna conscious
by hearing about Krishna,
by hearing about Krishna's activities,
Krishna's names,
Krishna's forms,
Krishna's pastimes,
Krishna's devotees,
Krishna's paraphernalia,
Krishna's creation.
Everything in connection with Krishna.
Krishna Katha.
You hear Krishna Katha.
Absorb your mind in Krishna Katha.
And become completely transcendental to everything material.
And in that way,
if you are situated at the time of death,
then you straight go back to Godhead.
And that's exactly what Parikshit did.
So Srila Prabhupada says,
Maharaj Parikshit,
after receiving warning of his death,
took advantage of this opportunity
by association with Shukadeva Goswami
and achieved the desired result.
This is Parikshit Maharaj's good fortune
that he was very anxious
when he was sitting for,
preparing for death.
He was very anxious to somehow
hear about Krishna,
think about Krishna,
talk about Krishna,
engage in devotional service to Krishna.
And when he got the association of Shukadeva Goswami,
he took full advantage
of hearing
about Krishna
and
getting to know
about Krishna properly.
And thereby becoming attached to Krishna,
automatically detached from everything material.
And
he developed that
attraction for Krishna
by which he straight went back to Godhead
after quitting the present body.
Srila Prabhupada warns
that because Shukadeva Goswami spoke for seven days
the stream of Bhagavatam to Parikshit Maharaj,
other people are imitating Shukadeva Goswami
by speaking Bhagavatam for only one week.
They call it Bhagavata Saptaha.
But this Saptaha is not at all effective.
We can clearly see.
So,
for
us to be successful
in preparing ourselves to go back to Godhead,
we should not only hear seven days
but we should hear every day
for rest of the life,
the Srimad Bhagavatam.
That is the recommendation of Bhagavatam.
Nityam Bhagavata Sevaya.
And in that way
we can prepare ourselves
to go back to Godhead.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
